TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ThemeConfigurationDialog extends System.Windows.Forms.Form

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Represents a common dialog box that allows the user to specify a workflow theme to apply to a workflow design surface. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
ThemeConfigurationDialog allows users to create and edit user-defined workflow themes and apply user-defined, default, and operating-system defined themes to a workflow design surface,

The to be highlighted in the theme configuration dialog box in the workflow designer.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using an <xref:System.IServiceProvider> and .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The theme that is highlighted in the theme configuration dialog box is the theme that is currently applied to the workflow design surface. Possible values include the default workflow theme, the operating system color theme, and any user-defined themes.

Docs.exception: contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

Docs.summary: Gets the workflow theme that is highlighted in the theme configuration dialog box in the workflow designer.
